paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses various TTR gene variants associated with transthyretin-mediated amyloidosis (ATTRv), including their clinical significance, penetrance data, and patient demographics.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: 7 ATTRv asymptomatic carriers (4 with the V50M mutation, 2 V142I, 1 P84L)
7 ATTRv asymptomatic carriers (4 with the V50M mutation, 2 V142I, 1 P84L)
7 ATTRv asymptomatic carriers (4 with the V50M mutation, 2 V142I, 1 P84L)
7 ATTRv asymptomatic carriers (4 with the V50M mutation, 2 V142I, 1 P84L)

functional_data.summary: The V50M mutation is associated with reduced antioxidant capacity and increased oxidative stress.

variants.segregation_data: The V50M variant segregates with the asymptomatic carrier status in the family.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the role of oxidative stress in ATTRv and the importance of early detection in asymptomatic carriers.
key_quotes: ATTRv asymptomatic carriers were considered FAP 0.
Patients with ATTRv showed reduced FORD compared to ATTRwt and ATTRv asymptomatic carriers.
